subject: Hockey, Ice
Athletics and Sports
Free Agents (Sports)
lead_paragraph: After losing Chris Drury and Daniel Brière to free agency, the Buffalo Sabres made sure they held onto the high-scoring forward Thomas Vanek. The Sabres signed Vanek, 23, to a seven-year, $50 million contract, matching the offer from the Edmonton Oilers. Vanek, entering his third season, became one of the N.H.L.’s top-paid players after he led Buffalo with 43 goals last season. He also finished 20th in the league with 84 points.
